arg_2.original_prompt: Write a blog post about the benefits of using a digital marketing agency, make sure to write at least 20 sentences.

resps:
**The Power of Partnering with a Digital Marketing Agency: Unlocking Your Business's Full Potential**

In today's digital age, having a strong online presence is crucial for any business looking to stay ahead of the competition. With the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing, it can be overwhelming to navigate the complex world of SEO, social media, and content creation on your own. That's where a digital marketing agency comes in  a team of experts dedicated to helping your business thrive online.

By partnering with a digital marketing agency, you can tap into a wealth of knowledge and expertise that can help you achieve your business goals. Here are just a few of the many benefits of working with a digital marketing agency:

**Increased Online Visibility**

A digital marketing agency can help you increase your online visibility by optimizing your website for search engines, creating engaging content, and developing a social media strategy that resonates with your target audience.

**Improved Brand Awareness**

With a digital marketing agency on your side, you can build a strong brand identity that sets you apart from the competition. From logo design to content creation, we can help you develop a consistent brand message that resonates with your audience.

**Targeted Advertising**

A digital marketing agency can help you target your advertising efforts to reach the right people at the right time. With advanced analytics and targeting capabilities, we can ensure that your ads are seen by people who are most likely to convert.

**Increased Conversions**

By creating targeted campaigns and optimizing your website for conversions, a digital marketing agency can help you drive more sales, leads, and revenue for your business.

**Cost Savings**

When you partner with a digital marketing agency, you can save time and money by outsourcing your marketing efforts to a team of experts. No need to hire and train a team of in-house marketers  we've got you covered!

**Access to Advanced Technology**

A digital marketing agency has access to the latest technology and tools, allowing us to stay ahead of the curve and implement the most effective marketing strategies for your business.

**Data-Driven Decision Making**

With advanced analytics and reporting capabilities, a digital marketing agency can provide you with data-driven insights that help you make informed decisions about your marketing efforts.

**Scalability**

As your business grows, a digital marketing agency can scale with you, providing the resources and expertise you need to take your marketing efforts to the next level.

**Expertise**

A digital marketing agency is staffed by experts in their field, with years of experience in digital marketing. We stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices, ensuring that your marketing efforts are always effective.

**Flexibility**

Whether you need a one-time project or ongoing marketing support, a digital marketing agency can adapt to your needs, providing flexible solutions that meet your unique business goals.

**Results-Driven**

At the end of the day, a digital marketing agency is only as good as the results we deliver. We're committed to driving real results for your business, whether that means increased website traffic, more leads, or higher conversions.

**Increased Efficiency**

By outsourcing your marketing efforts to a digital marketing agency, you can free up more time to focus on what you do best  running your business. We'll handle the marketing, so you can focus on the things that matter most.

**Access to a Network of Partners**

A digital marketing agency often has a network of partners and affiliates, providing access to a wider range of services and expertise. This can be especially beneficial for businesses with complex marketing needs.

**Improved Customer Engagement**

By creating engaging content and developing a social media strategy that resonates with your audience, a digital marketing agency can help you build stronger relationships with your customers.

**Competitive Advantage**

In today's competitive market, having a strong online presence is no longer a nice-to-have  it's a must-have. A digital marketing agency can help you stay ahead of the competition by providing a competitive edge in the market.

**Increased Customer Acquisition**

By driving more traffic to your website and creating targeted campaigns, a digital marketing agency can help you attract more customers and grow your business.

**Improved Customer Retention**

By building stronger relationships with your customers and providing a seamless customer experience, a digital marketing agency can help you retain more customers and reduce churn.

In conclusion, partnering with a digital marketing agency can be a game-changer for your business. With their expertise, technology, and resources, you can achieve your marketing goals and take your business to the next level. Whether you're looking to increase online visibility, improve brand awareness, or drive more conversions, a digital marketing agency is the perfect partner to help you achieve your goals.

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a proposal for a research project on the impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy. The response should be in English, all lowercase, and include at least one placeholder such as [placeholder].

resps:
here is a proposal for a research project on the impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy:

title: assessing the long-term economic impact of the liberian civil war (1989-2003)

background: the liberian civil war, which lasted from 1989 to 2003, had a devastating impact on the country's economy, infrastructure, and human capital. the war led to widespread destruction, displacement, and loss of life, resulting in a significant decline in the country's economic output and a prolonged period of economic stagnation. despite the end of the war, liberia's economy has yet to fully recover, and the country remains one of the poorest in the world.

research question: what were the long-term economic impacts of the liberian civil war, and how have they affected the country's economic development and growth in the post-war period?

objectives:

* to examine the economic costs of the liberian civil war, including the destruction of infrastructure, loss of human capital, and decline in economic output
* to assess the impact of the war on liberia's economic institutions, including the banking system, trade, and investment
* to evaluate the effectiveness of post-war economic policies and interventions in promoting economic recovery and growth
* to identify the key factors that have contributed to liberia's slow economic recovery and growth in the post-war period

methodology:

* literature review: a comprehensive review of existing research on the liberian civil war and its economic impacts
* data collection: collection of primary and secondary data on liberia's economy during the war and post-war periods, including data on economic indicators such as gdp, inflation, and unemployment
* case studies: in-depth case studies of specific sectors or industries that were affected by the war, such as agriculture, mining, and manufacturing
* statistical analysis: statistical analysis of the data to identify trends, patterns, and correlations between economic indicators and the war

expected outcomes:

* a comprehensive understanding of the long-term economic impacts of the liberian civil war
* identification of the key factors that have contributed to liberia's slow economic recovery and growth in the post-war period
* recommendations for policy interventions and strategies to promote economic development and growth in liberia

timeline:

* literature review and data collection: [placeholder] months
* case studies and statistical analysis: [placeholder] months
* writing and revising the research report: [placeholder] months

budget:

* literature review and data collection: $ [placeholder]
* case studies and statistical analysis: $ [placeholder]
* writing and revising the research report: $ [placeholder]
* total budget: $ [placeholder]

this research project aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of the long-term economic impacts of the liberian civil war and identify the key factors that have contributed to liberia's slow economic recovery and growth in the post-war period. the findings of this study will be useful for policymakers, development practitioners, and researchers seeking to promote economic development and growth in liberia.

resps:
**Welcome, students! Today, we're going to explore the fascinating world of Shinto shrines.**

Shinto shrines, also known as jinja, are sacred spaces that play a significant role in Japanese culture and spirituality. Located throughout Japan, these shrines are dedicated to the worship of kami, which are believed to be the spirits or energies that inhabit the natural world.

**The Main Hall (Honden)**

The main hall of a Shinto shrine is the most sacred area, where the kami is enshrined. The honden is typically a small, simple structure with a tiled roof and a torii gate, which marks the entrance to the shrine. Inside, you'll often find a few sacred objects, such as:

* A mirror (kagami): symbolizing the connection between the physical and spiritual worlds
* A sword (katana): representing the power of the kami
* A sacred scroll (emaki): containing prayers and blessings

**The Approach and Courtyard (Sando and Nakimon)**

As you approach the shrine, you'll notice a carefully designed path, known as the sando, which leads to the main hall. The sando is often lined with stone lanterns, stone torii gates, and other decorative elements. The courtyard, or nakimon, is a peaceful space where visitors can reflect and purify themselves before entering the shrine.

**The Treasure House (Honden)**

The treasure house, or honden, is a small building located near the main hall, where sacred objects and treasures are stored. These treasures may include:

* Ancient artifacts and relics
* Sacred texts and scrolls
* Artworks and sculptures
* Offerings and donations from devotees

**A Visit to a Shinto Shrine**

When visiting a Shinto shrine, it's customary to:

* Purify your hands and mouth with water from the purification fountain (temizuya)
* Bow twice upon entering and exiting the shrine
* Make an offering, such as a coin or a prayer, at the shrine's altar
* Take a moment to reflect and appreciate the beauty of the surroundings

**Conclusion**

Shinto shrines are not only beautiful and historic structures but also sacred spaces that hold great significance in Japanese culture. By understanding the different components and customs of a Shinto shrine, we can gain a deeper appreciation for the rich spiritual heritage of Japan.

**Additional Resources**

For those interested in learning more, I recommend visiting the [address] of the shrine you're interested in, or exploring online resources such as the Japan Guide or the Shinto Shrine Association.

Thank you for joining me on this journey into the world of Shinto shrines!

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a parody of 'ars poetica'. Do not include the word 'parody' throughout your response.

resps:
The doleful din of dinner's din
When hunger's pangs begin to pinch within
The kitchen's chaos, a cacophony keen
As pots and pans clang out a discordant sheen

The sauce, a sorry sight, does slowly set
A gloopy mess, a culinary regret
The meat, a mystery, does stubbornly resist
The knife's keen edge, and refuses to insist

The flavors, flat and faint, do falter and fall
As taste buds tremble, and the senses stall
The aroma, absent, does not arise
To tease the nose, and tantalize the eyes

But still we toil, in this gastronomic grind

arg_2.original_prompt: What's different between "the set of all sets that are not members of themselves" and "the set of all sets"? Use mathematical notations in your answer. Be chatty while explaining. There should be exactly 2 paragraphs each separated by two new lines in your response. Paragraph 1 must start with the word booster.

resps:
Booster! Let's dive into the fascinating world of set theory! The phrase "the set of all sets that are not members of themselves" might seem like a mouthful, but it's actually a clever way to describe a specific set. We'll denote this set as R, for "Russell's set" (named after Bertrand Russell, who first proposed it). R is defined as the set of all sets X such that X is not an element of itself, or mathematically: R = {X | X  X}. Think of it like a filter: only sets that don't contain themselves make it into R.

Now, let's contrast R with the set of all sets, which we'll call U (for "universe"). U is simply the set of all sets, without any conditions or restrictions. Mathematically, U = {X | X is a set}. The key difference between R and U is that R is a subset of U, meaning that R contains only a subset of all sets. In fact, R is often referred to as the "complement" of U, since it contains all sets that are not in U. But here's the mind-blowing part: if R were to contain itself, then it would be a set that is a member of itself, which would mean it can't be in R! This creates a paradox, known as Russell's paradox, which shows that R cannot exist as a set.

The age-old riddle: "What can you catch but not throw?" *cue dramatic music*

It was a chilly winter morning when I stumbled upon this brain-twister. I was sipping on a piping hot cup of coffee, trying to shake off the lingering effects of a late night Netflix binge. As I pondered the riddle, I couldn't help but think of all the things I could catch  a fly, a ball, a cold... wait, what was that last one again?

I decided to put my detective skills to the test and set out to solve the mystery. I asked my trusty sidekick, a wise-cracking cat named Mr. Whiskers, if he knew the answer. He gave me a sassy meow and a dismissive flick of his tail, as if to say, "Duh, human, it's a cold, of course!"

But I was determined to figure it out on my own. I spent the next hour brainstorming, scribbling notes on a whiteboard, and generally making a fool of myself. *cue montage of me looking ridiculous*

Just when I was about to give up, it hit me  a cold! You can catch a cold, but you can't throw one. I mean, can you imagine trying to hurl a sniffly, snotty, coughing fit at someone? *shudder* No, no, no. It's just not a thing.

I let out a triumphant whoop and did a little dance in my living room, much to the dismay of Mr. Whiskers, who was trying to take a nap. "I did it, Whiskers! I solved the riddle!" I exclaimed, still bouncing up and down.

Mr. Whiskers gave me a disdainful look and muttered something about " humans being ridiculous." But I didn't care  I had caught the answer, and I was feeling like the cat's pajamas!

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a rubric for rating how good a teenager's essay is. Give your final summary, following 6 asterisk symbols (******).

resps:
**Rubric for Rating a Teenager's Essay**

**Content (40 points)**

* Thesis statement (5 points):
	+ Is the thesis statement clear and concise?
	+ Does it effectively address the prompt?
* Main arguments (15 points):
	+ Are the main arguments well-supported with evidence?
	+ Are the arguments logically connected and well-organized?
* Evidence and examples (10 points):
	+ Are the examples relevant and effectively used to support the arguments?
	+ Are the sources credible and properly cited?
* Counterarguments and refutations (5 points):
	+ Are counterarguments acknowledged and addressed?
	+ Are refutations logical and well-supported?
* Conclusion (5 points):
	+ Is the conclusion effective in summarizing the main points?
	+ Does it leave the reader with something to think about?

**Organization and Structure (20 points)**

* Introduction (5 points):
	+ Is the introduction engaging and effective in setting up the essay?
	+ Does it provide a clear roadmap for the reader?
* Body paragraphs (10 points):
	+ Are the paragraphs well-organized and logically connected?
	+ Are the transitions between paragraphs smooth and effective?
* Conclusion (5 points):
	+ Is the conclusion effective in summarizing the main points?
	+ Does it leave the reader with something to think about?

**Writing Style and Conventions (20 points)**

* Clarity and concision (10 points):
	+ Is the writing clear and easy to understand?
	+ Are the sentences concise and well-organized?
* Grammar and mechanics (5 points):
	+ Are the sentences grammatically correct?
	+ Are the punctuation, capitalization, and spelling correct?
* Tone and voice (5 points):
	+ Is the tone consistent and effective?
	+ Is the voice engaging and authentic?

**Total Score**

* 90-100 points: Excellent essay. The student demonstrates a strong understanding of the topic, presents well-supported arguments, and writes clearly and effectively.
* 80-89 points: Good essay. The student demonstrates a good understanding of the topic, presents some well-supported arguments, and writes clearly.
* 70-79 points: Fair essay. The student demonstrates a fair understanding of the topic, presents some arguments, and writes adequately.
* 69 points and below: Needs improvement. The student demonstrates a limited understanding of the topic, presents few or no well-supported arguments, and writes poorly.

******

This rubric assesses the teenager's essay based on its content, organization, and writing style. The essay is evaluated on its ability to present a clear and well-supported thesis statement, main arguments, and evidence, as well as its organization and structure. The writing style and conventions, including clarity, grammar, and tone, are also evaluated. The final score is based on the total points earned, with 90-100 points indicating an excellent essay, 80-89 points indicating a good essay, and so on.

First, we need to make sure you're wearing a special helmet to keep your head safe. It's like wearing a superhero cape, but for your brain!

Now, let's get to the bike! Make sure you're sitting on the seat with your feet flat on the ground. You should be able to put both feet flat on the ground with your legs bent a little bit.

Next, hold onto the handlebars with both hands. You can hold them tight or loose, whichever feels comfy for you!

Now, push one pedal down with one foot. This will make the bike start moving! As you start moving, lift the other foot up and put it back down on the pedal. Keep doing this, pushing one pedal down and then the other, and you'll be gliding along!

Remember to look where you want to go, not at the ground. Keep your eyes on the horizon or a point in front of you. This will help you stay balanced and on track!

If you need to stop, squeeze the brakes with your hands. You can also put one foot down on the ground to help you stop.

That's it! You're riding a bike! Just remember to have fun and be careful. And don't forget to wear that superhero helmet!

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a rap about the renaissance. It should be noticeably different from raps about other historical eras, and have an interesting or weird tone. Highlight at least 3 sections in your answer in markdown format.

resps:
**The Renaissance Rhapsody**

Yo, listen up, let me take you back in time
To the 14th to 17th century, when the arts were on the grind
It was a rebirth, a revival, a Renaissance in full swing
When the world was reborn, and the old ways started to sing

### **The Medici's Money Machine**

In Florence, Italy, the Medici family reigned
Their wealth and power, like a golden chain
They sponsored artists, and funded their dreams
And the city became a hub, where creativity beams
From Leonardo to Michelangelo, they all got a taste
Of the Medici's cash, and the art they would create
It was a patronage system, that fueled the fire
And the Renaissance was born, with a burning desire

### **The Muses of Madness**

But amidst the beauty, and the artful flair
There was a darker side, that nobody dared
To speak of the madness, that drove the artists wild
The obsessive passion, that made them go the extra mile
From Michelangelo's rage, to Leonardo's obsessive stare
The Muses of Madness, whispered secrets in their ear
It was a time of turmoil, of passion and of pain
When the line between genius and madness was thin and vain

### **The Anatomy of a Dream**

In the streets of Venice, the Carnival would play
A masquerade of masks, where the boundaries would sway
The Commedia dell'Arte, a theater of the absurd
Where the characters would dance, and the audience would be blurred
It was a time of experimentation, of pushing the limits wide
When the boundaries of reality, were tested and denied
From the anatomical drawings, to the fantastical machines
The Renaissance was a time, of endless dreams and schemes

So there you have it, a rap about the Renaissance
A time of rebirth, of art and of madness
It was a era of extremes, of beauty and of pain
But it was also a time, of endless creativity and gain.

doc.prompt: Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.

gen_args_0.arg_0:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.

resps:
As I stood in the kitchen, sipping my morning coffee, I couldn't help but think about the cousins. My cousins, who were once my partners in crime, my confidants, and my best friends. Now, they were scattered across the country, living their own lives, and I was left to wonder what had happened to the carefree days of our youth.

I remembered the summers we spent at my aunt's lake house, where we would spend hours swimming, fishing, and laughing together. My cousin, Emma, was always the first one in the water, her blonde hair streaming behind her like a golden banner. And my cousin, Max, was always the last one out, his competitive streak driving him to catch the biggest fish.

As we grew older, our relationships began to change. We started to drift apart, each of us pursuing our own paths. Emma went off to college, became a lawyer, and started a family. Max joined the military, saw the world, and came back with a newfound sense of purpose. And I... well, I became a writer, stuck in a rut, and struggling to find my place in the world.

But despite the distance and the differences, the cousins remained a constant in my life. We would meet up whenever we could, sharing stories of our adventures, and reminiscing about the good old days. And even though we were no longer the same carefree kids we once were, the bond between us remained strong.

As I finished my coffee, I heard the doorbell ring. It was Emma, come to visit for the weekend. We spent the day catching up, laughing, and reminiscing about old times. And as we sat on the porch, watching the sun set, I realized that even though we were no longer the same people we once were, the cousins would always be a part of me.

As the night wore on, and Emma prepared to leave, I walked her to the door, and we shared a long hug. "We may not be the same kids we once were," I said, "but we're still family, and that will never change."

Emma smiled, and nodded in agreement. "We're still the cousins," she said, "and that's all that matters."

arg_2.original_prompt: What are the steps to be followed for the documentation of a GM in SAP? Just list the steps without saying the word steps or step.

resps:
Here are the procedures for documenting a General Ledger Master (GM) in SAP:

1. Log in to SAP system and navigate to the General Ledger Master record.
2. Check if the GM already exists, if not create a new one.
3. Enter the company code and fiscal year.
4. Define the account type and account category.
5. Enter the account number and description.
6. Define the account hierarchy and sub-accounts.
7. Specify the account type-specific settings.
8. Define the account group and account group hierarchy.
9. Enter the account currency and exchange rate.
10. Save the GM record.
11. Perform a consistency check to ensure the GM is valid.
12. Post the GM to the general ledger.

So, is it true that people use time to buy money? Well, kind of! Let me explain. Imagine you're a farmer who grows delicious apples. You work hard to plant, water, and harvest your apples. arg_2.original_prompt: Write a persuasive email to a teenager who lives in Aberdeen, Scotland. The main point is to encourage them to volunteer at a local soup kitchen. At least 5 words in the output should be in all caps.

resps:
Subject: Make a Difference in Your Community - Volunteer at Our Soup Kitchen!

Dear [Name],

As a teenager living in Aberdeen, you're part of a vibrant and caring community that's always looking for ways to make a positive impact. I'm writing to encourage you to consider volunteering at our local soup kitchen, which provides vital support to those in need.

By volunteering at our soup kitchen, you'll not only be helping to serve hot meals to those who are struggling, but you'll also be gaining valuable LIFE SKILLS, such as teamwork, communication, and empathy. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside like-minded individuals who share your passion for making a difference.

As you may know, Aberdeen has a significant issue with FOOD POVERTY, and our soup kitchen is on the front lines of addressing this issue. By volunteering, you'll be helping to provide a safe and welcoming space for those who are struggling to access basic necessities like food and shelter.

But it's not all about the work - it's also about the people you'll meet and the connections you'll make. You'll have the chance to build relationships with our dedicated team of staff and volunteers, as well as the individuals we serve. You'll hear their stories, learn about their struggles, and be inspired by their resilience.

So, what are you waiting for? Take the first step towards making a difference in your community by volunteering at our soup kitchen. We're looking for enthusiastic and dedicated individuals like you to join our team and help us make a REAL DIFFERENCE in the lives of those around you.

If you're interested in learning more or would like to sign up to volunteer, please reply to this email or give us a call at [phone number]. We'd be delighted to chat with you more about the opportunities available.

Thank you for considering volunteering at our soup kitchen. Together, we can make a BIG IMPACT in our community!

Best regards,

[Your Name]

P.S. Don't forget to spread the word to your friends and family - every bit counts!

resps:
1/6. oh boy, i'm still trying to process this whole "earth being round" thing. i mean, i always kinda suspected it, but like, what if it's just a big ol' pancake? what if we're all just living on a giant, spinning plate?

2/6. so i was at the library, researching some random thing, and i stumbled upon this book about... wait for it... EARTH SCIENCE. and let me tell you, it was like a whole new world opened up. or should i say, a whole new sphere?

3/6. i mean, the pictures, the diagrams, the EVIDENCE. it was all so... round. and i'm just sitting there, going "wait, what? this can't be real. we're all just being lied to by the government and the media and the... and the... scientists?"

4/6. but then i started reading about the ships that sail across the ocean, and how they don't just fall off the edge. and the planes that fly around the world, and how they don't just crash into the... the... flatness.

5/6. and don't even get me started on the moon landing. i mean, i always thought it was just a big hoax, but now i'm starting to think... what if it's real? what if we really did walk on the moon? and what if the earth is actually... round?

6/6. so yeah, that's my story about how i found out the earth is round. it's been a wild ride, let me tell you. and i'm still trying to wrap my head around it all. but hey, at least i can finally stop worrying about falling off the edge of the world. #flatearth #roundearth #mindblown

Hier ist eine Zusammenfassung der Lobbying-Ausgaben von Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple und Amazon:

Google: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Google-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 21,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Registrierung bei der Federal Communications Commission (FCC) und der Federal Trade Commission (FTC) verwendet, um die Interessen der Firma bei der Regulierung von Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Technologie zu vertreten.

Facebook: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Facebook-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 13,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Registrierung bei der Federal Election Commission (FEC) und der Federal Communications Commission (FCC) verwendet, um die Interessen der Firma bei der Regulierung von Datenschutz, Online-Handel und politischen Werbung zu vertreten.

Microsoft: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Microsoft-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 9,2 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Registrierung bei der Federal Communications Commission (FCC) und der Federal Trade Commission (FTC) verwendet, um die Interessen der Firma bei der Regulierung von Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Technologie zu vertreten.

Apple: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Apple-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 6,8 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Registrierung bei der Federal Communications Commission (FCC) und der Federal Trade Commission (FTC) verwendet, um die Interessen der Firma bei der Regulierung von Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Technologie zu vertreten.

Amazon: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Amazon-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 14,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Registrierung bei der Federal Trade Commission (FTC) und der Federal Maritime Commission (FMC) verwendet, um die Interessen der Firma bei der Regulierung von E-Commerce, Logistik und Technologie zu vertreten.

Es ist wichtig zu beachten, dass diese Zahlen nur die offiziell gemeldeten Lobbying-Ausgaben der Unternehmen darstellen und mglicherweise nicht die gesamten Ausgaben fr Lobbying-Aktivitten widerspiegeln.
